name: Hypophosphatemic Osteomalacia with Hypercalciuria
chief_complaint: I've been having severe bone pain and muscle weakness for months, and I keep getting kidney stones
physical_findings: waddling gait due to muscle weakness
positive Chvostek's sign (suggestive of phosphate depletion)
prognosis: Chronic condition requiring lifelong management. With proper treatment, bone mineralization can improve and fracture risk decreases, but kidney stone recurrence remains a challenge.
description: A rare renal phosphate wasting disorder characterized by defective phosphate reabsorption in proximal tubules, leading to osteomalacia and paradoxical hypercalciuria. Often caused by FGF23-mediated phosphate wasting or intrinsic renal defects. Distinguished from other forms of hypophosphatemia by the presence of elevated 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D levels.
risk_factors: family history of renal phosphate wasting
